Instructions.Instruction1: In a bowl, mix lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, chopped rosemary, thyme, salt, black pepper, Dijon mustard, and honey to create a marinade.
Instructions.Instruction2: Coat chicken with the marinade and let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
Instructions.Instruction4: Grill chicken until fully cooked, basting with marinade.
Instructions.Instruction5: Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

RecipeDescription: A flavorful and healthy grilled chicken marinated in a zesty lemon and herb mixture.

Instructions.Instruction1: Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Instructions.Instruction2: In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, chopped tomatoes, corn, diced bell pepper, and chopped cilantro.
Instructions.Instruction3: In a separate bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, ground cumin, and salt.
Instructions.Instruction4: Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss until well combined.
Instructions.Instruction5: Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

RecipeDescription: A refreshing and protein-packed salad with quinoa, black beans, and colorful vegetables.

Instructions.Instruction1: Season shrimp with salt and pepper, then grill until cooked.
Instructions.Instruction2: In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, sliced avocado, halved cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced red onion.
Instructions.Instruction3: Whisk together olive oil, lime juice, chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper to create the dressing.
Instructions.Instruction4: Toss the salad with the dressing and top with grilled shrimp.

RecipeDescription: A light and refreshing salad with grilled shrimp, avocado, and a zesty lime dressing.

Instructions.Instruction1: Press tofu to remove excess water and cut into cubes.
Instructions.Instruction2: Stir-fry tofu until golden brown, then set aside.
Instructions.Instruction3: Stir-fry vegetables in sesame oil until tender-crisp.
Instructions.Instruction4: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, and minced garlic to make the teriyaki sauce.
Instructions.Instruction5: Add tofu and sauce to the vegetables, toss until coated.

RecipeDescription: A savory and sweet tofu stir-fry with colorful vegetables in a homemade teriyaki sauce.

Instructions.Instruction2: Place salmon fillets on sheets of foil, surround with asparagus and cherry tomatoes.
Instructions.Instruction3: Drizzle with olive oil and white wine (if using).
Instructions.Instruction4: Sprinkle with minced garlic, salt, pepper, and fresh dill.
Instructions.Instruction5: Seal foil packets and bake for 20 minutes.

RecipeDescription: A simple and healthy dish where salmon and asparagus are cooked to perfection in foil packets with a lemon-dill seasoning.

Recipe_Name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Enchiladas

Instructions.Instruction1: Cook diced sweet potatoes until tender.
Instructions.Instruction2: In a bowl, mix sweet potatoes, black beans, diced red onion, cumin, paprika, and garlic powder.
Instructions.Instruction3: Fill corn tortillas with the mixture, roll, and place in a baking dish.
Instructions.Instruction4: Pour enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Instructions.Instruction5: Bake until cheese is melted and bubbly.

RecipeDescription: A flavorful and satisfying vegetarian enchilada recipe with sweet potatoes, black beans, and a smoky enchilada sauce.

Instructions.Instruction1: Sauté chopped onions and garlic in olive oil until translucent.
Instructions.Instruction2: Add diced tomatoes and red bell pepper and stir in cumin and paprika.
Instructions.Instruction3: Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Instructions.Instruction4: Add drained chickpeas and cook until vegetables are tender.
Instructions.Instruction5: Season with salt and pepper then garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

RecipeDescription: A hearty and nutritious stew with chickpeas, tomatoes, and Mediterranean spices.

Instructions.Instruction1: Marinate salmon in a mixture of soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, and grated ginger.
Instructions.Instruction2: Cook rice according to package instructions.
Instructions.Instruction3: Steam broccoli and carrots until tender-crisp and grill or pan-sear salmon until cooked.
Instructions.Instruction4: Place rice in bowls, top with vegetables, and salmon.
Instructions.Instruction5: Drizzle with extra teriyaki sauce and garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.

RecipeDescription: A delicious bowl with teriyaki-glazed salmon, steamed rice, and colorful vegetables.

Recipe_Name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast

Instructions.Instruction1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C), in a pan, sauté chopped garlic in olive oil.
Instructions.Instruction2: Add fresh spinach and cook until wilted and combine spinach with crumbled feta, oregano, salt, black pepper, and lemon zest.
Instructions.Instruction3: Cut a pocket into each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach mixture then season the outside of the chicken with salt and pepper.
Instructions.Instruction4: Sear the chicken in a pan until golden brown.
Instructions.Instruction5: Transfer chicken to a baking dish and pour chicken broth, bake until the chicken is cooked through.

RecipeDescription: Juicy chicken breasts stuffed with a flavorful mixture of spinach, feta cheese, and herbs.

Recipe_Name: Black Bean and Quinoa Stuffed Peppers

Instructions.Instruction1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C), cut the tops off bell peppers and remove seeds.
Instructions.Instruction2: In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced red onion, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.
Instructions.Instruction3: Fill each pepper with the quinoa mixture and pour tomato sauce over the stuffed peppers.
Instructions.Instruction5: Bake until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

RecipeDescription: Colorful bell peppers filled with a nutritious blend of black beans, quinoa, vegetables, and spices.
